info.description: erster Entwurf einer Datenzugriffs-API, die den Zugriff auf die KomMonitor-Datenhaltungsschicht kapselt.
info.title: KomMonitor Data Access API

tags.name: spatial-units
tags.description: spatial units/levels, for which indicators can be associated (e.g. rastercells, building blocks, quarters, city districts, city boroughs, city)

tags.name: georesources
tags.description: Georesource necessary for the computation of indicators (e.g. land use, locations of schools, streets/ways)

401.description: API key is missing or invalid

put.summary: Modify/Update the features of the selected spatial-unit
put.description: Modify/Update the features of the selected spatial-unit. The interface expects a full upload of all geometries for the spatial unit. Internally, those geometries are compared to the existing ones to mark 'old' geometries that are no longer in use as outdated. Hence, each geometric object is only persisted once and its use is controlled by time validity marks.

parameters.description: the unique identifier of the spatial level

Internally, those geometries are compared to the existing ones to mark 'old' geometries that are no longer in use as outdated. Hence, each geometric object is only persisted once and its use is controlled by time validity marks.

get.summary: retrieve an empty script template, that defines how to implement process scripts for KomMonitor as JavaScript file.
get.description: retrieve an empty script template, that defines how to implement process scripts for KomMonitor. The script works as a template for a NodeJS module. Hence, it predefines required methods that are called by the executing processing engine (a NodeJS runtimne environment). As a script developer, those predefined methods have to be implemented. The template contains detailed documentation on how to implement those methods.

schema.description: the JavaScript NodeJS code containing executable code to compute the associated indicator.

401.description: API key is missing or invalid

priviledges.description: list of priviledges that are associated to this role. They indicate, what operations and data can be accessed by users.

accessibleGeoresources.description: mandatory list of identifiers of georesources that this role is allowed to retrieve. Specify 'ALL' to enable access to all existing georesources. If unspecified, than full content restriction is assumed (this means that this role cannot access any content).

accessibleIndicators.description: mandatory list of identifiers of indicators that this role is allowed to retrieve. Specify 'ALL' to enable access to all existing georesources. If unspecified, than full content restriction is assumed (this means that this role cannot access any content).

userId.description: the unique identifier of the user

userName.description: the user name from the login credentials

roles.description: list of roles the user is associated with

userName.description: the user name from the login credentials

password.description: the user password from the login credentials

roles.description: list of role identifiers; the user is associated with the rights/priviledges of each specififed role.

items.description: the roleId of the role, that shall be applioed to the user

spatialUnitId.description: the unique identifier of the spatial unit level the features apply to

spatialUnitLevel.description: the name of the spatial unit level the features apply to

nextLowerHierarchyLevel.description: the identifier/name of the spatial unit level that contains the features of the nearest lower hierarchy level

nextUpperHierarchyLevel.description: the identifier/name of the spatial unit level that contains the features of the nearest upper hierarchy level

wmsUrl.description: the URL of a running WMS instance serving the spatial features of the associated dataset

wfsUrl.description: the URL of a running WFS instance serving the spatial features of the associated dataset

sridEPSG.description: the coordinate reference system of the dataset as EPSG code

datasource.description: information about the origin/source of the dataset

contact.description: contact details where additional information can be achieved

lastUpdate.description: a timestamp representing the lastUpdate according to ISO 8601 (e.g. 2018-01-30)

earliestStartDate.description: a timestamp representing the earliest starting date according to ISO 8601 (e.g. 2018-01-30), for which the dataset can be queried

endDate.description: an optional timestamp representing the latest ending date according to ISO 8601 (e.g. 2018-01-30). The parameter can be omitted, if the end date is unknown.

AvailablePeriodOfValidityType.description: definition of earliest and latest date of validity. May be used to understand, which timestamps can be used to query the data

spatialUnitLevel.description: the name and identifier of the spatial unit level the features apply to

nextLowerHierarchyLevel.description: the identifier/name of the spatial unit level that contains the features of the nearest lower hierarchy level

nextUpperHierarchyLevel.description: the identifier/name of the spatial unit level that contains the features of the nearest upper hierarchy level

jsonSchema.description: a JSON schema as string that defines the data model for this dataset. It can be used to validate the geoJsonString property.

geoJsonString.description: a valid GeoJSON string containing the features consisting of a geometry and a unique identifier as property 'uuid'

startDate.description: a timestamp representing the starting date according to ISO 8601 (e.g. 2018-01-30)

endDate.description: an optional timestamp representing the ending date according to ISO 8601 (e.g. 2018-01-30). The parameter can be omitted, if the end date is unknown.

PeriodOfValidityType.description: definition of the period of validity of a certain dataset

geoJsonString.description: a valid GeoJSON string containing the features consisting of a geometry and a unique identifier as property 'uuid'

nextLowerHierarchyLevel.description: the identifier/name of the spatial unit level that contains the features of the nearest lower hierarchy level

nextUpperHierarchyLevel.description: the identifier/name of the spatial unit level that contains the features of the nearest upper hierarchy level

datasetName.description: the meaningful name of the dataset

georesourceId.description: the unique identifier of the dataset

applicableTopics.description: array of thematic categories for which the dataset is applicable. Note that the used topicName has to be defined under /topics

allowedRoles.description: list of role identifiers that have read access rights for this dataset

isPOI.description: boolean value indicating if the dataset contains points of interest

poiSymbolBootstrap3Name.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI marker symbol can be set by specifying the name of a Bootstrap 3 glyphicon symbol (i.e. "home" for a home symbol or "education" for a students hat symbol)

poiMarkerColor.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI marker color can be set by specifying one of the following color names

poiSymbolColor.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI symbol color can be set by specifying one of the following color names

wmsUrl.description: the URL of a running WMS instance serving the spatial features of the associated dataset

wfsUrl.description: the URL of a running WFS instance serving the spatial features of the associated dataset

datasetName.description: the meaningful name of the dataset

allowedRoles.description: list of role identifiers that have read access rights for this dataset

applicableTopics.description: array of thematic categories for which the dataset is applicable. Note that the used topicName has to be defined under /topics

isPOI.description: boolean value indicating if the dataset contains points of interest

poiSymbolBootstrap3Name.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI marker symbol can be set by specifying the name of a Bootstrap 3 glyphicon symbol (i.e. "home" for a home symbol or "education" for a students hat symbol)

poiMarkerColor.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI marker color can be set by specifying one of the following color names

poiSymbolColor.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI symbol color can be set by specifying one of the following color names

jsonSchema.description: a JSON schema as string that defines the data model for this dataset. It can be used to validate the geoJsonString property.

geoJsonString.description: a valid GeoJSON string containing the features consisting of a geometry and properties specific to the dataset
a valid GeoJSON string containing the features consisting of a geometry and properties specific to the dataset

allowedRoles.description: list of role identifiers that have read access rights for this dataset

applicableTopics.description: array of thematic categories for which the dataset is applicable. Note that the used topicName has to be defined under /topics

isPOI.description: boolean value indicating if the dataset contains points of interest

poiSymbolBootstrap3Name.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI marker symbol can be set by specifying the name of a Bootstrap 3 glyphicon symbol (i.e. "home" for a home symbol or "education" for a students hat symbol)

poiMarkerColor.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI marker color can be set by specifying one of the following color names

poiSymbolColor.description: If georesource is a POI then custom POI symbol color can be set by specifying one of the following color names

indicatorType.description: indicates whether the indicator is a status indicator (values represent the extent of the watched phenomenon for a certain point in time) or a dynamic indicator (values represent the change of extent of the watched phenomenon within a certain period of time)

processDescription.description: description about how the indicator was computed

applicableSpatialUnits.description: array of spatial unit levels for which the dataset is applicable

applicableDates.description: array of applicable dates (year and month and day as YEAR-MONTH-DAY) according to ISO 8601 (e.g. 2018-01-30)

applicableTopics.description: array of thematic categories for which the dataset is applicable. Note that the used topicName has to be defined under /topics

allowedRoles.description: list of role identifiers that have read access rights for this dataset

referencedIndicators.description: list of references to other indicators

creationType.description: indicates if the data is simply inserted (INSERTION), computed by an automated script (COMPUTATION) or automatically aggregated by a script (AGGREGATION)

lowestSpatialUnitForComputation.description: identifier/name of the lowest spatial unit for which the indicator can be computed and thus is available (only necessary for computable indicators)

ogcServices.description: list of available OGC services for that indicator for different spatial units

referencedIndicatorId.description: unique identifier of the referenced indicator

referencedIndicatorName.description: the meaningful name of the referenced indicator

referencedIndicatorDescription.description: a meaningful description of how the referenced indicator is related to the main indicator

IndicatorReferenceType.description: a reference to another indicator, e.g. a sub-indicator that is used to compute the main indicator

referencedGeoresourceId.description: unique identifier of the referenced georesource

referencedGeoresourceName.description: the meaningful name of the referenced georesource

referencedGeoresourceDescription.description: a meaningful description of how the referenced georesource is related to the main indicator

GeoresourceReferenceType.description: a reference to georesource, e.g. a resource that is used to compute the main indicator

colorBrewerSchemeName.description: the name of the colorBrewer color scheme jused to define the colors for classification (see project http://colorbrewer2.org/#type=sequential&scheme=BuGn&n=3 for colorSchemes). Set to 'INDIVIDUAL' if colors are set arbitrarily.

items.description: array of classification mapping items. The order of the items corresponds to indicator value intervals from low to high. The number of items represents the number of classes. In combination they represent the default classification and mapping to custom rating of the indicator values

defaultColorAsHex.description: the default color for the specified value interval as hex string inclusive leading #, i.e. '#ffffff'

defaultCustomRating.description: the default custom rating string for the specified value interval, i.e. 'very high'/'very low' or 'good'/'bad'

spatialUnit.description: the name of the spatial unit

wmsUrl.description: the URL of a running WMS instance serving the spatial features of the associated dataset

wfsUrl.description: the URL of a running WFS instance serving the spatial features of the associated dataset

defaultStyleName.description: the name of the default style (SLD) that is published and applied to the associated dataset

datasetName.description: the meaningful name of the indicator

indicatorType.description: indicates whether the indicator is a status indicator (values represent the extent of the watched phenomenon for a certain point in time) or a dynamic indicator (values represent the change of extent of the watched phenomenon within a certain period of time)

applicableSpatialUnit.description: identifier/name of the spatial unit level

applicableTopics.description: array of thematic categories for which the dataset is applicable. Note that the used topicName has to be defined under /topics

processDescription.description: description about how the indicator was computed

creationType.description: indicates if the data is simply inserted (INSERTION), computed by an automated script (COMPUTATION) or automatically aggregated by a script (AGGREGATION)

lowestSpatialUnitForComputation.description: identifier/name of the lowest spatial unit for which the indicator can be computed and thus is available (only necessary for computable indicators)

allowedRoles.description: list of role identifiers that have read access rights for this dataset

refrencesToOtherIndicators.description: array of references to other indicators. E.g., if an indicator is defined by combining four other indicators, then the identifiers of those other indicators can be referenced here

refrencesToGeoresources.description: array of references to other georesource datasets. E.g., if an indicator is defined by performing geometric-topological operations, then the identifiers of those required georesources can be referenced here

indicatorValues.description: an array of entries containing indicator values and mapping to spatial features via identifiers
an array of entries containing indicator values and mapping to spatial features via identifiers

applicableTopics.description: array of thematic categories for which the dataset is applicable. Note that the used topicName has to be defined under /topics

processDescription.description: description about how the indicator was computed

allowedRoles.description: list of role identifiers that have read access rights for this dataset

lowestSpatialUnitForComputation.description: identifier/name of the lowest spatial unit for which the indicator can be computed and thus is available (only necessary for computable indicators)

refrencesToOtherIndicators.description: array of references to other indicators. E.g., if an indicator is defined by combining four other indicators, then the identifiers of those four indicators can be referenced here

refrencesToGeoresources.description: array of references to other georesource datasets. E.g., if an indicator is defined by performing geometric-topological operations, then the identifiers of those required georesources can be referenced here

spatialUnitFeatureId.description: the id of the spatial feature

spatialUnitFeatureName.description: the name of the spatial feature

validStartDate.description: the start date from which on the spatial feature is valid

validEndDate.description: the end date until the spatial feature is valid - or null if not set

description.description: short description of the scripts content (what does it do)

scriptId.description: unique identifier of the process script

indicatorId.description: unique identifier of the associated indicator (e.g. the indicator that is computed by a script or for which the values shall be aggregated to another spatial unit)

requiredIndicatorIds.description: identifiers of indicators that are used within the script.

requiredGeoresourceIds.description: identifiers of georesources that are used within the script.

variableProcessParameters.description: list of process parameters that can be set by an expert user. They are used within the script to parameterize the indicator computation

name.description: the name of the process input parameter

description.description: a short description of the process input

dataType.description: the data type of the process input

defaultValue.description: the default value of the process parameter

maxParameterValueForNumericInputs.description: the maximum value that is allowed for the process parameter

minParameterValueForNumericInputs.description: the minimum value that is allowed for the process parameter

description.description: short description of the scripts content (what does it do)

associatedIndicatorId.description: unique identifier of the associated indicator (e.g. the indicator that is computed by a script or for which the values shall be aggregated to another spatial unit)

scriptCodeBase64.description: the actual script code (JavaScript) as BASE64 encoded string

requiredIndicatorIds.description: identifiers of indicators that are used within the script.

requiredGeoresourceIds.description: identifiers of georesources that are used within the script.

variableProcessParameters.description: list of process parameters that can be set by an expert user. They are used within the script to parameterize the indicator computation

description.description: short description of the scripts content (what does it do)

scriptCodeBase64.description: the actual script code (JavaScript) as BASE64 encoded string

requiredIndicatorIds.description: identifiers of indicators that are used within the script.

requiredGeoresourceIds.description: identifiers of georesources that are used within the script.

variableProcessParameters.description: list of process parameters that can be set by an expert user. They are used within the script to parameterize the indicator computation

referenceDescription.description: short description of how the indicator is referenced to the superior one
short description of how the georesource is referenced to the indicator

timestamp.description: timestamp consisting of year, month and day according to ISO 8601 (e.g. 2018-01-30)

indicatorValue.description: the numeric extent of the indicator for the timestamp

spatialReferenceKey.description: identifier (uuid) of the spatial feature to which the values shall be applied

valueMapping.description: an array of entries mapping an indicator value to a timestamp as mapping key

UnauthorizedError.description: API key is missing or invalid
